text: see bigger orders towards market closed it's for liquidity reasons this is very very normal but if we take a look at the kind of Trades that came through we see a lot of average price trades which is really really interesting because notice what the the word picture here it says a trade where the price reported is based upon an average of the prices for the transactions in a security during all or any portion of the trading day and it's because these are bigger positions like you're not going to put on you know a 4.6 million position and just have it magically slide through it's just not how it works so there were a ton a ton of really big trades going on now a quick reminder there's a difference between orders that go through through dark pools versus lit exchanges versus orders that are internalized orders that go through dark pools still hit the Consolidated tape they're not internalized inherently now you can have internalized dark pool orders but then you you you wouldn't see them because they're internalized they don't hit any tape so these will still hit the Consolidated tape which is exactly why we see the volume going absolutely Bonkers as we look at this through like a time scale because again this is going to track the cumulative volume as we move around right so you see 34 million 56 like it starts scaling meaningfully right into um right into the
